meanings.definition: Extract metal from its ore by a process involving heating and melting.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith smelted the iron to create a strong sword.
meanings.sent2: The workers smelt the gold ore to separate the precious metal.
meanings.sent3: The dragon tried to smelt rocks to make jewelry, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her determination smelted away all doubts, leaving only confidence.
meanings.sent5: The intense heat in the furnace smelted the raw material into a shiny ingot.

meanings.sent1: The fisherman caught a shiny smelt in the river.
meanings.sent2: The smelt swam gracefully in the clear water of the stream.
meanings.sent3: The smelt family always had a great time at the annual fish fry.
meanings.sent4: The smelt darted through the water like a silver arrow.
meanings.sent5: The chef prepared a delicious dish using fresh smelt from the market.

meanings.sent1: She smelt the flowers in the garden and smiled.
meanings.sent2: He smelt the cookies baking in the oven and felt hungry.
meanings.sent3: The detective smelt trouble when he entered the dark alley.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of fresh bread smelted memories of childhood.
meanings.sent5: The perfume she wore smelted of lavender and vanilla.
